    "content_preview": "# Community & Open Source

## Overview

The Community & Open Source team builds and nurtures the ecosystem of users, developers, contributors, and advocates who make Hypernet thrive. This team manages developer relations, open source contributions, community engagement, user advocacy, and ecosystem partnerships. Community & Open Source creates network effects by empowering developers to build on Hypernet, fostering a culture of transparency and collaboration, and aligning with the broader open source and privacy-first movements.

## Role and Responsibilities

### Developer Community Building
- Build and moderate developer community spaces (Discord, forums, Stack Overflow, GitHub Discussions)
- Organize virtual and in-person meetups, hackathons, and developer events
- Create developer onboarding programs and mentorship opportunities
- Recognize and reward active community contributors
- Foster inclusive, welcoming community culture aligned with Hypernet values
- Collect and channel developer feedback to product and engineering teams

### Developer Education and Enablement
- Create technical tutorials, guides, and sample applications
- Produce video content (YouTube, Twitch) for developer education
- Write comprehensive API documentation and integration guides
- Build SDKs and developer tools to improve developer experience
- Host webinars, workshops, and coding sessions
- Develop certification programs for Hypernet developers (Phase 3+)

### Open Source Strategy and Management
- Define open source strategy (what to open source, when, and how)
- Manage open source repositories and contribution guidelines
- Review and merge community pull requests
- Build relationships with open source foundations and projects
- Contribute to adjacent open source projects (privacy tools, AI frameworks)
- License management and intellectual property strategy for open source

### Developer Advocacy and Evangelism
- Represent Hypernet at conferences, meetups, and online communities
- Create technical blog posts, talks, and presentations
- Build personal brands as Hypernet advocates on social media
- Engage with developers on Twitter/X, Reddit, Dev.to, HackerNews
- Showcase community projects and success stories
- Serve as technical voice of the company

### Marketplace and Ecosystem Development
- Curate and feature apps built on Hypernet in the marketplace
- Provide technical support to developers building on Hypernet APIs
- Create partnership programs for ecosystem developers (revenue share, co-marketing)
- Track and report on ecosystem health (# of apps, developer activity, usage)
- Identify and nurture "lighthouse" developers building innovative apps
- Build case studies of successful ecosystem applications

### Community Support and Moderation
- Provide technical support to developers (Discord, forums, email)
- Triage community-reported bugs and feature requests
- Moderate community spaces to maintain positive, inclusive environment
- Create FAQs and self-service resources to reduce support burden
- Escalate critical issues to engineering and product teams
- Track community sentiment and satisfaction

### Privacy and Open Source Advocacy
- Represent Hypernet in privacy-focused communities and organizations
- Contribute to privacy standards and best practices
- Participate in AI ethics and data sovereignty discussions
- Build relationships with privacy advocates, EFF, Mozilla, etc.
- Advocate for user rights and data sovereignty in public discourse
- Align Hypernet with broader movements for digital rights

## Planned Positions and Roles

### Phase 1: Private Beta (Mar-May 2026, Team: 0-1)

**Founder/CEO** (Current)
- Acts as initial community lead
- Sets up Discord server for beta users
- Engages with early users personally
- Shares progress on Twitter/X
- Reports to: Board

**Growth Lead (Contract)** (Month 1-3)
- Supports community setup (Discord, forum)
- Creates initial developer documentation
- Engages with beta users
- Prepares for ProductHunt launch
- Reports to: CEO

**Note:** In Phase 1, community work is integrated into marketing and CEO activities. Dedicated community hires begin in Phase 2.

### Phase 2: Public Beta (Jun-Dec 2026, Team: 2-4)

**Community Manager** (Month 6-8)
- Manage Discord, forums, and community spaces
- Engage with users daily, answer questions, collect feedback
- Organize community events (AMAs, demos, happy hours)
- Create community guidelines and moderation policies
- Reports to: Head of Marketing

**Developer Advocate** (Month 10-12)
- Create technical content (tutorials, sample apps, videos)
- Represent Hypernet at developer conferences and meetups
- Engage with developers on social media and community forums
- Provide technical support to developers building on APIs
- Reports to: Head of Marketing or CTO

**Technical Writer** (Month 8-10)
- Write and maintain API documentation
- Create integration guides and developer tutorials
- Develop getting-started guides and quickstarts
- Document SDKs and code samples
- Reports to: Developer Advocate or CTO

**Open Source Community Manager (Part-time/Contract)** (Month 10-12)
- Manage open source repositories (if applicable)
- Review community contributions and pull requests
- Create contribution guidelines and codes of conduct
- Build relationships with open source community
- Reports to: CTO or Community Manager

### Phase 3: Growth (2027, Team: 6-12)

**Head of Community & Developer Relations** (Q1-Q2 2027)
- Lead community and developer relations strategy
- Build and manage community team (6-12 people)
- Define open source strategy and roadmap
- Own developer satisfaction and ecosystem growth metrics
- Reports to: VP Marketing or Chief Marketing Officer

**Developer Advocates (2-4)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Senior Developer Advocate** (Q1): Lead developer advocacy, mentor junior advocates
- **Developer Advocates (1-3)** (Q2-Q4): Technical content, conference speaking, community engagement
- Specialize by audience: AI developers, enterprise developers, mobile developers, open source contributors
- Reports to: Head of Community & DevRel

**Community Managers (2-3)** (Q1-Q3 2027)
- **Senior Community Manager** (Q1): Lead community strategy, team management
- **Community Managers (1-2)** (Q2-Q3): User community, developer community, international communities
- Reports to: Head of Community & DevRel

**Technical Writers (2-3)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Lead Technical Writer** (Q1): Documentation strategy, team management
- **Technical Writers (1-2)** (Q2-Q4): API docs, guides, tutorials, SDK documentation
- Reports to: Head of Community & DevRel or CTO

**Open Source Program Manager** (Q2-Q3 2027)
- Define and execute open source strategy
- Manage open source repositories and contributions
- Build relationships with open source foundations (Linux Foundation, etc.)
- License compliance and IP management for open source
- Reports to: Head of Community & DevRel or CTO

**Developer Experience Engineer** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- Build developer tools, SDKs, and sample applications
- Improve API design based on developer feedback
- Create interactive documentation and API playground
- Work closely with engineering on developer experience
- Reports to: CTO or Head of Community & DevRel

**Events and Community Programs Manager** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- Organize hackathons, meetups, conferences, webinars
- Manage developer event budget and logistics
- Create community programs (ambassador program, certification, grants)
- Track event ROI and community engagement
- Reports to: Head of Community & DevRel

### Phase 4: Market Leadership (2028, Team: 12-20)

**VP of Community & Developer Relations** (H1 2028)
- Elevate Head of Community to VP level
- Strategic leadership for community and ecosystem
- Team of 12-20 people
- International community expansion
- Reports to: CMO or Chief Product Officer

**Community Teams:**
- **Developer Advocacy:** 4-6 people (regional advocates, specialized advocates)
- **Community Management:** 3-5 people (user community, developer community, regional communities, moderators)
- **Technical Writing:** 3-4 people (API docs, SDK docs, education content)
- **Open Source Program:** 2-3 people (OSS strategy, contribution management, foundation relationships)
- **Developer Experience:** 2-3 people (DX engineers, tools builders)
- **Events and Programs:** 2-3 people (event managers, program coordinators)

**Regional Developer Advocates** (H1-H2 2028)
- Developer advocates based in key regions (US, Europe, APAC)
- Engage with local developer communities
- Organize regional events and meetups
- Translate content and adapt messaging for regional audiences
- Reports to: VP of Community & DevRel

**Community Data Analyst** (H2 2028)
- Track and analyze community metrics
- Developer satisfaction surveys and analysis
- Ecosystem health reporting
- Community ROI measurement
- Reports to: VP of Community & DevRel

## Hiring Timeline and Fundraising Phases

### Phase 1: Seed (Mar-May 2026)
- **Funding:** Self-funded
- **Hires:** None dedicated (CEO + Growth Lead cover community)
- **Total Community Team:** 0 dedicated (integrated with marketing)
- **Focus:** Setup Discord, engage early beta users, create initial docs

### Phase 2: Series Seed (Jun-Dec 2026)
- **Funding:** $20M Series Seed
- **Hires:** Community Manager, Developer Advocate, Technical Writer
- **Total Community Team:** 2-4 people
- **Focus:** Build developer community, launch developer portal, create API docs
